standards.standard: Version must be of the form vX.Y where X is the major and Y is the minor release
Avoid exposing technical attributes or attributes that are not useful for common use cases
Where apis interact with cross platform objects - use the common name e.g. user, bundle, resource (not channel or stream) and common object definitions
Should only respond to supported operations
Must follow Client Server
Must be Stateless
Must be Layered System
Must follow HTTP spec
standards.description: All HTTP standards defined in HTTP 1.1 must be followed. It is not required to support everything in the HTTP spec, but if supported, then it must follow the spec. Examples like GET must be safe and idempotent, UT must be idempotent, etc.

standards.standard: Accept/Content-Type must be supported.
ETag must be supported if the resource supports caching.
Accept-Language/Content-Language must be supported if the resource is language sensitive.
Location header must be supported.
standards.description: When a new resource is created through a POST request, the Location header must be provided in the response with the URL to the newly created resource.

standards.standard: If-Match and If-None-Match should be supported if a resource supports caching.
Must use response codes to indicate the result of HTTP request according to HTTP spec.
4xx must be used for problems that client can fix.
5xx must be used for problems that client cannot fix.
If additional error information is provided then, it must be included in the error response body and it must be valid against the exception detail complex type.
standards.description: It contains mandatory type and title properties, and optionally status, detail, instance, o:errorCode, o:errorPath, and o:errorDetails.

standards.standard: If partial update is required, then PATCH should be supported.
standards.description: Missed in V1.1, added in V1.2.

standards.standard: If PATCH is supported, then it is recommended to suport POST tunneling.
standards.description: Missed in V1.1, added in V1.2.

standards.standard: All names must be semantically precise w/o unnecessary qualifiers.
Collection resource name must be plural.
standards.tranquilize_notes: Currently Checks the resource url for this standard

standards.standard: All names should be camel case w/o hyphen/underscore/number unless semantically meaningful.
standards.tranquilize_notes: Currently Checks the resource url for this standard

standards.standard: All names should be Initial lower case.
Identifier field names should have Id suffix or be named as id.
standards.tranquilize_notes: There does not seem to be an indication of which property is the id - no Oracle meta property for example. Therefore we ask for the id in the checkers meta-data. We verify that this id is always present in any of the representation of the resource

standards.standard: Nice to have: boolean field names end with Flag
Nice to have: fields that indicate a user end with "By"
JSON must be supported.
XML might be supported.
standards.change_log: Changed to be optional in v1.2

standards.standard: Root resource URI must follow: "/"[context"/"]version"/"resourceName.
Must be only one root URI per unique resource.
URI of singular resource within a collection must follow: "/"[context"/"]version"/"resourceName"/"resourceId.
Sub resource URI must follow: "/"[context"/"]version"/"resourceName"/"accessorResourceName.
Resource representation should include the identifier attributes.
Amount complex type should be used to represent amount value with a unit of measure.
Currency type should be used to represent money.
Singular resource must follow the base singular resource definition.
standards.description: A singular resource must use "links" property to capture the link relations. Its value is an array and each item in the array is a link object. A link object is an object, with mandatory rel and href properties. It may have templated, mediaType, method and profile properties.

standards.standard: Collection resource must follow the base collection resource definition.
standards.description: A collection resource must use "items" to contain the items. It may contain optional properties: totalResults, limit, count, hasMore, offset.

standards.standard: Response returned from GET "/"[context] must be valid against oracle collection resource schema.
/"[context]"/"version must return representation that is valid against oracle version resource schema.
standards.description: It contains lifecycle, isLatest, terminationDate, and catalog properties.

standards.standard: Self link should be included.
If self link is provided, rel must be self.
Canonical link should be included.
If canonical link is provided, rel must be canonical.
Links to children should be included.
Link to parent should be included.
If parent link is provided, rel should be parent.
Link to related resources should be included.
Pagination should be provided for collection resource.
Pagination links may be either placed in the header, or in the response body. If it is in the header, then it must be located in the Link section of the HTTP header.
Next link must be provided if pagination is enabled and there is a next page. rel must be "next".
Previous link must be provided if pagination is enabled and there is a previous page. rel must be "prev".
First link may be provided if pagination is enabled. If provided, rel must be "first".
Last link may be provided if pagination is enabled. If provided, rel must be "last".
Metadata should be provided.
If metadata is provided, then the metadata URI must be "/"[context"/"]version"/metadata-catalog/"resourceName.
/"[context"/"]version"/metadata-catalog/"resourceName must support GET and return a Schema resource.
standards.description: A schema resource supports two media types: application/json and application/schema+json. The default is application/json, and the resource contains resource name, link to the JSON schema of the resource, and other links.

standards.standard: /"[context"/"]version"/metadata-catalog/"resourceName must support GET and return json schema of the resource,  if media type is application/schema+json.
OPTIONS should be provided at "/"[context"/"]version"/"resourceName, with response header containing a link to json schema with rel=describedby.
If metadata is provided, then GET should be supported at /"[context"/"]version"/metadata-catalog/" and return a Catalog resource.
standards.description: A Catalog resource is a collection, with its item a Schema resource.

standards.standard: If metadata is provided, a resource must be valid against its schema.
Collection resource schema should extend Oracle base collection resource schema.
Singular resource schema should extend Oracle base singular resource schema.
It is optional to support expanding the child resource in the response.
If expanding child resources is supported, then "expand" query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be comma separated child resource names.
Optional to support dotted annotation for nested child in "expand" query parameter.
Optional to support "expand=all" to expand all child resources.
It is optional to support projection (restricting what fields to return).
If projection is supported, then "fields" query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be comma separated child resource name.
Optional to support dot annotation for nested child in "field" query parameter.
If pagination is supported, then "limit" and "offset" query parameters must be supported.
limit query parameter must be used to control how many rows to return.
"offset"query parameter must be used to control from which row the response contains.
If pagination is supported, then "fromId" query parameter may be supported.
"fromId" query parameter must be used to retrieve items from specified ID.
If pagination is supported, then "since" query parameter may be supported.
"since" query parameter must be used to retrieve items newer than specified timestamp.
If pagination is supported, then "until" query parameter may be supported.
"until" query parameter must be used to retrieve items older than specified timestamp.
It is optional to support where clause when querying a collection resource.
If where clause is supported, then "q" query parameter must be used to achieve that.
It is optional to support including the total row count in response. (Beyond what is in the current response.)
If total row count is supported, then "totalResults" query parameter must be used to achieve that. Syntax: "totalResults=true" or "totalResults=false". Default is false.
When totalResults=true is specified, response must contain "totalResult" property. This property contains total number of rows.
Optional: support sorting in collection resource query.
If sorting is supported, then "orderBy" query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be a comma separated tokens. Each token is fielddName[":"("asc"/"desc")].
Syntax for "orderBy": optional to support dot annotation of the field name.
Optional to support restricting what links to return.
"links" query parameter must be used to restrict which links to return. The query parameter value must be a comma separated rel names.
It is optional to support "toId" query parameter.
"toId" query parameter must be used to specify that the returned items must have an identifier less than the specified query parameter.
Basic Auth over SSL must be supported.
OAuth must be supported (when it is available).
When caching is supported, etag, If-Match, and If-None-Match must be used to achieve it.
Accept-Language and Content-Language must be used to specify the language requested/responded if content negotiation is supported.
Timezone sensitive Datetime values must use the ISO 8601 format: YYYYMMDDThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z
Timezone insensitive date values must use YYYYMMDD format .
For a timezone sensitive datetime value and the timezone varies object by object, then the value should be represented using the Object Specific Datetime Complex type.
If metadata is supported, and a resource supports content negotiation, then o:languageNegotiable must be used to describe that.
For a resource that supports content negotiation, it is optional to support langpref query parameter.
If a query parameter is used to specify preferred language for content negotiation, then langpref must be used.
For a resource that supports content negotiation, it is optional to support lang query parameter, which determines which lang must be used.
If a query parameter is used to dictate which language is used, then it must be lang.
It is optional to support asynchronous interaction mode.
If asynchronous interaction mode is supported, then resource metadata should contain "o:interaction" in its hyper media metadata.
standards.description: The "o:interaction" keyword is a property in the link, and its value is an array. Each item in the array must be one of the following: sync, async-pooling, async-response, async-notify.

standards.standard: If asynchronous interaction mode is supported, then resource links should include "interaction" property.
standards.description: The value of "interaction" property is an array. Each item in the array must be one of the following: sync, async-pooling, async-response, async-notify.

standards.standard: If server serves a request using async-polling mode, then 202 must be returned, and Location header must point to a Status resource.
GET must be supported for a Status resource, and the returned content must validate against Status resource schema.
If server serves a request using async-response mode, then server must POST response back to client when it finishes processing, using the provided callback identifier in the request.
If server serves a request using async-notify mode, then server must POST a status URL back to the client when it finishes processing, using the provided callback identifier in the request.
It is optional to provide a create-form resource.
standards.description: A create-form resource provides default values.

standards.standard: If a create-form resource is provided, then it must provide a link (with rel=create) back to the original resource where a new resource can be created.
standards.description: Usually the original resource is a collection resource.

standards.standard: If a create-form resource is provided, then the original resource must contain a link to the create-form resource with rel=create-form.
If a create-form resource is provided, then its metadata should contain a link to the original resource with rel=create.
standards.description: Usually the original resource is a collection resource.

standards.standard: If a create-form resource is provided, then the original resource's metadata should contain a link to the create-form resource with rel=create-form.
if "q" query parameter is supported, and metadata is supported, then metadata should include "q" query parameter syntax. includes
standards.description: The schema should contain a search link in its hypermedia metadata and the search link should contain schema. In schema's properties, "q" query parameter should be defined with a "format" keyword. The format must be either "mongo", or "scim", or a URI to the search-form resource.

standards.standard: if "q" query parameter is supported and uses MongoDB format, then "mongo" must be used in its schema.
standards.description: Check M041

standards.standard: if "q" query parameter is supported and uses SCIM's filtering format, then "scim" must be used in its schema.
standards.description: Check M041

standards.standard: if "q" query parameter is supported and uses a custom format, then its schema must provide the URI to access the search-form.
standards.description: Check M041

standards.standard: if "q" query parameter is supported and uses a custom format, then a search-form must be provided.
standards.description: Check M041

standards.standard: A search-form resource must validate against search-form's schema.
if a search-form resource is provided, then the collection resource should have a link to the search-form resource. The rel should be search-form.
if a search-form resource is provided, then it should contain a link to the corresponding collection resource with rel=search.
